com.lasarobotics.library.monkeyc

Class MonkeyC

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lasarobotics.library.monkeyc.MonkeyC

  • public class MonkeyC
extends java.lang.Object
    The MonkeyC (MonkeySee) library that handles recording and storing driver controls These controls can be inserted during runtime (when the robot is moving) or can be created prior to a match. MonkeyDo can then execute these commands.

    • Constructor Summary

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Returns true if the MonkeyC timer is paused.

        Please note that time continues running during a custom function, but controller input will NOT be recorded until the function completes.

        To resume time, press any controller button or joystick when NOT currently executing a custom function.

        Returns:
        True if paused, false if running

      • getTime

        public float getTime()
        Gets the time of the MonkeyC clock
        Returns:
        The time of the clock, in seconds.

      • pauseTime

        public void pauseTime()

      • resumeTime

        public void resumeTime()

      • waitForController

        public void waitForController(Controller controller1,
                     Controller controller2)
        Wait for a controller key update to continue the clock

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the entire command list. All commands will be deleted.

      • end

        public void end()
        End the command stream. After this, no further commands can be written.

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String filename)
        Write the final JSON to a file

        If the file exists, a new file with appended ".1", ".2", etc. will be created It is recommended to use the other implementation and set overwrite to true if you're viewing the file from a manager that does not show hidden files.

        Parameters:
        filename - The filename to write to

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String filename,
         boolean overwrite)
        Write the final JSON to a file
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename to write to
        overwrite - True to overwrite file if exists, false to append ".1", ".2", etc. to the end if exists

      • getCommandsWritten

        public int getCommandsWritten()
        Returns the count of items in the command array
        Returns:
        The count of items in the command array
